title: Removing a working set immediately triggers refiltering in the package view
description: When I delete a working set in the application, the package view in the background immediately triggers a refiltering. However, I believe the refiltering should only occur when closing the working set selection dialog, not during the manipulation process. Additionally, I expect that pressing cancel should revert any changes made to the working sets, including canceling the removal process.
OB: When I delete a working set, the package view immediately refilters.
EB: When I delete a working set, the package view should only refilter when I close the working set selection dialog. Pressing cancel should revert any changes made to the working sets, including canceling the removal process.
SR:
1. Open the application.
2. Navigate to the working set management section.
3. Select a working set to delete.
4. Click on the delete button.
5. Observe that the package view immediately refilters.
6. Close the working set selection dialog.
7. Observe that the package view refilters again.
8. Repeat steps 3-5 and press cancel instead of deleting.
9. Verify that the changes made to the working set are reverted and the working set is not removed.
